results.title: The Castle
results.creator_credit: Rob Sitch, Debra Choate and Working Dog
results.brief_description: How Darryl Kerrigan, average working joe, and his small time suburban lawyer mate, Denis Denuto ended up in the High Court of Australia is the story told in ‘The Castle’. The Kerrigan family live at 3 Highview Crescent, Cooloroo, on the edge of an international airport, in total obscurity. That is until the consortium owning the airport decide to expand and the land surrounding the airport is to be compulsorily acquired from the residents. What the powers-that-be did not count on was the dogged determination of Darryl Kerrigan, greyhound racer, tow-truck driver with a keen eye for a bargain, to whom his house is his family’ home and a very happy one at that. Ordinary family.

results.title: The Castle
results.brief_description: The Kerrigans are happy living near Melbourne airport. However, they’re forced to leave their beloved home to make way for more runways and The Castle is the story of their fight to remain in their home.

constellations_other.name: Landscape as Character
constellations_other.description: The landscape is often a character in Australian films. Usually, it's a villain that represents our problematic national character and is increasingly used to challenge our troubled history and explore our evolving identities.

results.description: A Melbourne family is very happy living near the airport. However, they’re forced to leave their beloved home (by the Government and airport authorities) to make way for more runways. The Castle is the story of their fight to remain in their home.
description_for_label: A Melbourne family is very happy living near the airport. However, they’re forced to leave their beloved home (by the Government and airport authorities) to make way for more runways. The Castle is the story of their fight to remain in their home.

results.title: The Castaway cowboy
results.creator_credit: Vincent McEveety, Winston Hibler, Ron Miller and Walt Disney Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Disney family film about a shipwrecked cowboy, Lincoln Costain (James Garner) on a Hawaiian island, and his adventures with widow Henrietta MacAvoy (Vera Miles) and land baron Bryson (Robert Culp). Henrietta has a struggling potato farm and through the aid of Lincoln, the farm is eventually turned into a successful cattle ranch. Bryson, who holds Henrietta’s mortgage, wants her land and is prepared to go to any length to get it. On confronting this predicament Lincoln has to decide whether to stay and fight for Henrietta or return to his home in Texas. Cast includes Eric Shea, Elizabeth Smith, Manu Tupou.

results.title: The Cashmere story
results.creator_credit: Robert Pringle and Son and Associated British-Pathe
results.brief_description: Hawick, in Scotland, has been the centre of a thriving knitting trade for over 200 years. Shows the raw material of the industry, obtained from the Kashmir goat in the mountains beyond the Himalayas, transformed into the finished product. Highly skilled workers are seen making the articles for which the industry is justly famous. Historic Edinburgh provides the setting for a display of fashionable sweater designs.

results.title: The Cashew nut story
results.creator_credit: S.B. Nayampally, C L Aggarwal and National Education and Information Films
results.brief_description: The cashew nut industry in Kerala, India. Part of the Indian Government five-year plan is to promote and develop this growing industry. With government loans and cashew tree cuttings, the Development Officer encourages local farmers to help poor farms become self-supporting. he advises the planting of other crops between the trees. The cashew crop is sold to a co-operative store where it is dried, bagged, weighed, roasted, shelled, graded then finally packed for world-wide export.

results.title: The Case of the travelling garden
results.creator_credit: Raymond Leach, Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Department of Customs checks on all plants being brought into Australia and administers agricultural quarantine regulations. Travellers are required to leave behind all fruit and vegetables, flowers and bulbs for these may be disease-carrying. Australia is fortunate in having so much agriculture which is free from any overseas pests and diseases. Uses animation. (For the Plant Quarantine Publicity Campaign, 1972).

results.title: The Case of the missing magnets
results.brief_description: Reviews the basic principles of human relations, and the problem of motivating employees to better teamwork, and productivity. A dramatization helps supervisors understand that discipline goes hand-in-hand with human relations in moulding an effective team.

results.title: The Case of the missing chickows: adding positive and negati
results.brief_description: Presents the mysterious didappearance of curious creatures called chickcows to introduce students to pairing as a procedure for adding positive and negative integers. Story by E.D. Bogas and Mitch Rose. Animation by Mitch Rose. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Case of the cosmic comic
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Homer Price’s good friend Freddy is a true-blue hero worshipper whose idol is the azure-caped Super-Duper. After meeting the super-human hero in person at the Centerburg movie theatre, the boys encounter him again - only this time the Super-Duper is badly in need of their assistance. From the book “Homer Price” by Robert McCloskey.
